ygData.subject: Wanderings & a new friend

Subject: Wanderings & a new friend

From: steph_teltoli@...

(OOC: Hey Carnage, could you reply soon, please? :D Can't go on with 
these wandering posts forever you know.. *grin*)

Teltoli had made it well into a forest now, tucking away her wings in 
favour of walking and searching. One couldn't see anything through 
the thick cover of these trees, and she didn't mind walking, not when 
the scenary was beautiful like this! Dead pine needles crunched under 
paw, the smell of pine filled her nsoe, and the chirping of birds 
cascaded in her ears.

So far she hadn't found any sign of Carnage. After this she would 
head for the mountains..

A small smile crossed her cat features. Total peace - and she loved 
it! A rustling of wings was heard, and a flash of brown and white 
shot over her head. Starteled, she looked up to see a Bald Eagle land 
on the branch above her head. An actual Bald Eagle, not a 
transformer. She cocked her head to one side and transformed into her 
Bot Mode. The Eagle didn't even blink an eyelid, seemingly used to 
this sort of thing.

Slowly, Teltoli held her arm out towards the eagle, who peered at her 
with golden eyes. The Bot made crooning noises, hoping the bird would 
trust her. With a jerky movement, the bald eagle hopped onto her arm, 
his large talons curling around her wrist and elbow. He was huge!

She let herself smile, and lowered her arm so she could face the bird 
eye to eye. The eagle started preening himself, and seemed content to 
stay with her. He turned a bit, and Teltoli noticed with a start that 
some of his tail feathers were singed.

"Poor baby.." She whispered "Did you get caught in the tail end of a 
blast? If you'll excuse the pun.." She smiled, and mentally rolled 
her eyes. "I'm talking to a bird' She told herself.

Noticing it was getting slightly dark, she sat down at the foot of a 
tree, and set the eagle on the forest floor. He watched her with big 
curious eyes as she transformed back into her Fuzor Mode, and lay 
down at the foot of the tree. With a squawk, he fluttered up to a 
branch that was no more than two feet above her head, and fluffed his 
feathers, keeping watch while she took a quick nap.
